N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 686.5 - Governance

State Regulations
(a) Principles of compliance. (1)

Each agency operating one or more community residences shall have a governing
body (see glossary, section
686.99
of this Part). (2)

Unless a governing body is broadly
representative of the community (see glossary, section
686.99
of this Part) in which a
community residence is located, the agency shall have a community advisory
board composed of at least residents of the neighborhood in which the
residences are located and persons from the community residences. As a matter
of State policy, all OPWDD-operated community residences shall have at least an
agency-wide community advisory board. A community advisory board shall have at
least the following functions: (i) to
organize itself, elect officers and direct its activities; (ii)
to advise the residence managers and the
governing body with regard to the operation of the community
residences; (iii)
to assist persons
living in the community residences to be integrated into the community in which
the facilities are located; (iv)
to
assist neighborhoods to accept the persons living in the community residences
as neighbors; and
(v) to have
advisory responsibilities during at least the first full year of operation of
the community residence. (b) Standards of certification. (1)

When a community advisory board is
required, there is verification (see glossary, section
686.99
of this Part) that the
membership includes at least one party who is a resident of a neighborhood in
which a facility is located and one person who lives in a community
residence. (2)

There is evidence
that, if applicable, there is either an agency-wide or site specific community
advisory board in operation during at least the facility's first year of
operation. Notes
